hierarchy.entry_domain: NIST SP 800-53 Security and Privacy Controls

active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate the effectiveness of DNSSEC (as per SC-20/SC-21) versus alternative mitigations like DNS over HTTPS (DoH) in preventing real-world attacks such as DNS cache poisoning. Support arguments with NIST references and evaluate trade-offs for enterprise adoption.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in NIST SP 800-53 controls. Topic: Secure name/address resolution (SC-20, SC-21, SC-22) in System and Communications Protection (SC). Full hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Security And Risk Management > Security Control Frameworks > NIST SP 800-53 > SC > Secure name/address resolution. Core content: SC-20 requires authoritative sources to provide DNSSEC signatures, cryptographic keys, child zone status for chain-of-trust. SC-21 mandates recursive/caching resolvers to validate signatures, restrict to trusted sources, request signed responses. SC-22 ensures detection/reporting of resolution failures/anomalies. Aligns with ITSG-33 Annex 3A (Canadian CCCS: cryptographic verification, integrity for authoritative/recursive services). Big picture: Prevents DNS attacks (cache poisoning, Kaminsky) in zero-trust. Prerequisites: DNS basics (authoritative/recursive). Misconceptions: Resolvers sign data (no), DNSSEC encrypts (no, signs only). Incorporate: - Learning objectives: [paste the 6 objectives above] - Scaffolding: 4 layers [paste scaffolding details] - Active learning: Tie explanations to activities. Generate 25 flashcards following EXACT schema: { "bloom_level": "...", "question": "...", "correct_answer": "...", "distractors": [ {"text": "...", "explanation": "..."}, {"text": "...", "explanation": "..."}, {"text": "...", "explanation": "..."} ], "explanation": "..." } Output ONLY a JSON array of 25 flashcards. Balance: 4 Remember/Understand, 8 Apply/Analyze, 8 Evaluate, 5 Create. Cover all layers. Distractors: 3 always, plausible from misconceptions/attacks/frameworks. University pedagogy: Active, measurable.
